title: So AD champions are allowed to have a good spellvamp option
body: But AP champs aren't? What the actual fuck.

And you can't possibly believe that they won't give the assassins with no sustain far too much sustain. Death's Dance effectively makes AD assassins immune to poke. Yi healing during Qs while untargetable. Zed healing during ulti combos while untargetable and bouncing around the map. Talon healing while invisible. It's seriously the worst idea I've ever seen, and your excuse for why AP champs get the shaft is laughable when the problem is already far worse on the AD side.

You don't build spellvamp on Leblanc because spellvamp sucks and only exists on items that either suck or have wasted stats. If any spellvamp item gave you lots of free aoe damage, a big shield, or a mini Poppy passive, you can be sure that Leblanc would be building it.

You build lifesteal (and now physical vamp) because the items are just better. They have extremely useful effects aside from just healing, like % hp on hit, cleave damage, cleave burst, a shield, staggered burst damage, etc. On top of that, lifesteal is fucking *everywhere.* Now from masteries to your starting item to components to completed items, and procs, you can stack the everloving shit out of lifesteal without even intending to just by getting items you want for their other strengths.

Vamp items do nothing but vamp. Apples to apples here, the AP equivalent of lifesteal items would be spellvamp on Liandry's, Seraph's, Morello, and Rylai's. Just as a bonus on top of the %hp damage, shield, debuff, and slow.

Plus, there are tons of mage abilities that are tagged as aoe regardless of how many enemies it actually hits or if it's even capable of hitting multiple enemies. For example, Kat's Q. You use it on an isolated enemy and it doesn't bounce. Too bad it's still tagged as aoe and your 15% vamp is only 5% vamp.

Without Zhonya's mages wouldn't be able to go mid anymore. Zhonya's is mandatory when you face any assassin in lane (even LeBlanc) to put the lane even for both players. Without it, no matter how much better you play with your mage, Zed would still wreck you in lane once he had built some damage.

Zhonya's is not a bad design, it's the answer to a fundamental flaw in the game that no one has be able to figure out how to address for years.

Zhonyas doesn't even the playing field though

if you are behind, and you zhonyas, usually you come out of it and immediately die afterwards.

It works best when you are ahead, and that is why it's frustrating. When Diana towerdives you and is about to die to the tower shots, and then she zhonyas and then the tower switches aggro to minions, that's frustrating, that is zhonyas seeing use. When swain or kennen push r and walk into a group of enemies and hit zhonyas, if they're behind massively, then it doesn't matter, they come out of it and die. It's only if they are fed enough, that the aoe of their ults will ravage the enemy team.

While it doesn't exactly even out the laning phase, it can even out teamfights. If you are caught out, and you zhonyas to prevent death at the hands of the whole enemy team, your team can pick it up and destroy the enemy team (or otherwise secure the area around you) while you come out alive. Of course this depends on your team being strong enough to contest ground (which again, makes it less of an equalizer). If your team isn't strong enough (or they choose not to, which is unfortunately common in soloQ), then you come out surrounded by multiple enemy champions and die.

Zhonyas is not a "build this and you're back in the game" item. A lot of mages don't build this item, and many opt into it as a 3rd (or later) item.

{{champion:8}} becomes broken. And because of how his kit works, its impossible to just "Nerf his numbers" to balance it out. He has proven to be extremely problematic whenever a good spell vamp item was made. And he will continue to do so until they can figure out a way to fix his issues.

I'm sure this has already been mentioned, but spellvamp is not allowed to be good on mages because of {{champion:8}} {{champion:84}} and {{champion:50}}.

At least with Life steal, champions regain their health in rapid small increments. As well, most AD casters only do 1/2 to 2/3 of the damage compared to their AP counterparts in one rotation of their abilities. AD Casters are assumed to use their AAs in their combos to make up for the difference in damage.

However, because most AP champions deal burst damage, if spellvamp is efficient on them they will literally regain more than half their HP bar in one well placed AOE from 700 units away.

Not to mention that Akali, Vladimir, and Swain would literally become invincible demons on the rift, leeching over 100% of their damage.
